reviewText: Was not sure I would like the movie, but really enjoyed it and recommend others to get their copy for weekend movie nights at home!
THE MOVIE I FELT WAS A REAL TOPIC. MANY GUYS CAN RELATE THIS. THIS MOVIE ALSO BROUGHT TEARS TO MY EYES. MOST OF ALL TOO DAMN SHORT LOL

I'd never heard of this movie when I picked it up in Walmart so I took a chance and bought it. That was $5.50 well spent because I was not disappointed. This movie is funny at times, sad at times, thought-provoking at times, but entertaining at all times. I actually cried at the end. I can't remember the last movie I watched that brought tears to my eyes. Anyhoo, I turned my ringer off so I wouldn't be disturbed. If you like "30 Years To Life" you'll like this movie too. The main reason I like this movie is because the characters are so real: the drunk who puts somebody on blast at the family gathering, the "Oreo" friend (black on the outside, white on the inside), the "Ms. Independent-I-Don't-Need-No-Man-I-Got-Dental-Benefits-and-my-own-business" female, the angry one who has that inner turmoil but is taking it out on everybody else, the so- called "Mack" who fronts like he's "The Man" when he's really on lock, the "We-need-to-take-this-relationship-to-another-level" one,(marriage) and the loud sister, the one who keeps the party going no matter what  (Wendy Raquel Robinson). The only thing I didn't like about this movie is that in some scenes women were referred to as "b-----s" and "h--s." Anyway, Guy Torry is an outstanding actor, he acted his heiny off in this one. His character is the one that stood out. But don't take my word for it, take a chance like I did and see it for yourself. You won't be disappointed.
i expected a bit more with this film,but it didn't quite get there. it had some moments. I got to see it recently&it was ok.there was some Foxxy looking chicks up in this movie.

i really enjoyed this movie. Great writing, great acting, nice story line.  Thoroughly pleased.  I can't wait to watch again with my crew... good movies are always better with a crowd.

P.S.  It was probably a 4 star movie, but I gave it 5 stars because I wasn't expecting what I got.

It was interesting to see how most people handle their relationship with others. I must say it was intruing to see that the movie didin't just deal with love relationships,but with how we handle our friendships as well.
